definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though

sentences.english: In short, the Father never denied his Son any request.
sentences.chinese: 總而言之，父神從來沒推卻祂兒子任何一個的祈求。

sentences.english: Mrs. Derrick had asked him to go for the mail at Bonneville, and he had not been able to refuse.
sentences.chinese: 臺力克太太拖他上波恩維爾去拿信，他不好意思推卻。

sentences.english: This glass of wine, which his friend definitely wouldn't refuse, must be tossed off at once.
sentences.chinese: 這杯酒，友人一定是毫不推卻，一飲而盡的。

definition: to be reluctant to give up a post
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to deliver/to send a letter/a letter (of complaint, opinion etc)
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
